column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Keisha Wright : Senator Delph , What are the political stands that are going to provide the sharpest contrast between you and your likely political opponent , JD Ford this fall ?
#Text=MD : Well again , I 've not yet had the chance to meet Mr. Ford .
#Text=I look forward to doing that , and I 've not had the chance to be educated on what he stands for , and what his positions are , and I look forward to doing that .

#Text=But what I 'm told , the biographical backgrounds and positions are pretty black and white , night and day , and so I think the voters , for what I 've been told without studying the issues on him , will get a sharp contrast .
#Text=You know I ’ve served in the Indiana State Senate for 8 years .
#Text=I spent four years in leadership as an assistant majority floor leader for communications revamping the whole communications process through two communications directors .
#Text=I 've carried a number of bills into law .
#Text=I 've served in business .
#Text=I 've run my own business out of my home .
#Text=Now I serve for a privately-held company as a general counsel .

#Text=I 've served for a publicly traded company as an executive in their government affairs department , and so I have a lot of business experience , applied experience in the Indiana General Assembly .
#Text=I ’ve also had a lot of family experience raising five daughters as a home school educator .
#Text=I ’ve been a leader in the military .
#Text=I currently am a major in the United States Army Reserve serving in a number of leadership capacities during the course of my military experiences .
#Text=So I 'm very confident and proud of my history , of my record , and I look forward to further communicating that with my voters and Senate District 29 .
#Text=And I also look forward to meeting my opponent after we get through the May primary .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Tew : Just a short question .
#Text=You started your military service in what year ?
#Text=MD : June of 2001 , I believe .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Tew : And you were promoted to major when ?
#Text=MD : I was promoted to major on March 23 , 2012 .
#Text=And that was also after the whole brouhaha over the military uniform issue with [ Lieutenant ] Colonel Mejia .
#Text=I was a company commander for the 310th Expeditionary Sustainment Command , at the time I was a captain , company commander .
#Text=And notwithstanding that I was still promoted to major .
#Text=I think the military almost on a weekly basis to take a leadership position in a unit .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Meredith Harris : You have been considered for higher offices .
#Text=What qualities do you have to offer not only your district , but voters all over Indiana ?
#Text=MD : Well , I ’ve not actively sought higher office .
#Text=I enjoy reading about my political future in the press routinely , oftentimes over coffee with my daughters .
#Text=You know , I love my country , I love my state , I love my neighbors , I love my community , I love my fellow man .
#Text=I ’m very concerned about the direction that our nation 's going .
#Text=In 2008 , we crossed a barrier that was not widely reported .
#Text=That was the first year that our nation started talking about operational deficits — the difference between revenue and expense on an annual basis — in terms of trillions of dollars .
#Text=It is mind boggling to me that since 2008 the United States government has added a trillion dollars in national debt each and every year .
#Text=We are spending our posterity into oblivion .
#Text=At some point our debt will not be marketable .
#Text=People wo n't think it 's a good enough risk to invest in and at that point Judgement Day happens .
